Package ohos.nfc.cardemulation

Class CardEmulation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.nfc.cardemulation.CardEmulation

  • public final class CardEmulation
extends Object
    Provides methods for card emulation management.

    These methods can be used to enable and disable card emulation, check whether card emulation is supported, query the card emulation state, customize radio frequency (RF) parameters, and set a preferred foreground application.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Communication#NFC

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CardEmulation getInstance​(NfcController controller)
        Obtains a singleton instance of the CardEmulation class.

        If no singleton instance is available, a singleton instance will be created.

        Parameters:
        controller - Indicates the singleton instance of the NfcController class.
        Returns:
        Returns a singleton instance.
        Since:
        1

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported​(int feature)
        Checks whether a specified type of card emulation is supported.

        This method is used to check Whether the host or secure element supports card emulation.

        Parameters:
        feature - Indicates the card emulation type, HCE, SIM, or ESE.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified type of card emulation is supported; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • setListenMode

        public void setListenMode​(int mode)
        Sets the card emulation mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the card emulation mode to be set. DISABLE_MODE_A_B: Indicates that card emulation is disabled. ENABLE_MODE_ALL: Indicates that card emulation is enabled.
        Since:
        1

      • isListenModeEnabled

        public boolean isListenModeEnabled​()
        Checks whether card emulation is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if card emulation is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getSelectionType

        public int getSelectionType​(String category)
        Obtains the method of selecting the service based on the NFC service type.
        Parameters:
        category - Indicates the NFC service type. CATEGORY_PAYMENT indicates a payment service, and CATEGORY_OTHER indicates a non-payment service.
        Returns:
        Returns SELECTION_TYPE_PREFER_DEFAULT if the default payment service is used; returns SELECTION_TYPE_ASK_IF_CONFLICT if the user selects a service from all available services.
        Since:
        1

      • getNfcInfo

        public String getNfcInfo​(String key)
        Obtains the NFC information.

        This method is used to obtain the NFCC or enabled SE information.

        Parameters:
        key - Indicates the keyword of the required information. See KEY_ENABLED_SE_TYPE, KEY_HISEE_READY, KEY_RSSI_SUPPORTED.
        Returns:
        Returns the NFCC or enabled SE information. See ENABLED_SE_TYPE_ESE, ENABLED_SE_TYPE_HISEE, HISEE_READY, HISEE_UNREADY, RSSI_QUERY_SUPPORTED, RSSI_QUERY_UNSUPPORTED.
        Since:
        1

      • registerForegroundPreferred

        public boolean registerForegroundPreferred​(Ability appAbility,
                                           ElementName appName)
        Registers a preferred foreground application.

        Before using host-based card emulation (HCE) for your application in the foreground, you can call this method to register your application as a preferred application, so that it will be preferentially used when swiping card.

        Parameters:
        appAbility - Indicates the ability object of the preferred foreground application.
        appName - Indicates the name of the preferred foreground application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • unregisterForegroundPreferred

        public boolean unregisterForegroundPreferred​(Ability appAbility)
        Unregisters a preferred foreground application.

        Before exiting an HCE application from the foreground, you can call this method to unregister it as the preferred foreground application.

        Parameters:
        appAbility - Indicates the ability object of the preferred foreground application.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the unregistration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • isDefaultForAid

        public boolean isDefaultForAid​(ElementName appName,
                               String aid)
        Checks whether the specified application is currently the default handler for the specified AID.
        Parameters:
        appName - Indicates the name of the application to check.
        aid - Indicates the specified AID in a string.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified application is the default handler for the specified AID; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • registerAids

        public boolean registerAids​(ElementName appName,
                            String type,
                            List<String> aids)
        Registers a list of AIDs of the specified type for a given application.

        If a list of AIDs of the specified type has been registered for the application, calling this method will replace that list with a new one.

        Parameters:
        appName - Indicates the name of the application for which the list of AIDs is to be registered.
        type - Indicates the AID type. The value can be CATEGORY_PAYMENT or CATEGORY_OTHER.
        aids - Indicates the list of AIDs to register.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the list of AIDs is registered successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • removeAids

        public boolean removeAids​(ElementName appName,
                          String type)
        Removes a previously registered list of AIDs of the specified type from a given application.

        This method only removes the AIDs that are dynamically registered using registerAids(ohos.bundle.ElementName,java.lang.String,java.util.List), and does not remove the AIDs that are statically registered. If dynamically registered AIDs of a specified type are removed but the statically registered ones are available in the application, the static AID group will become active.

        Parameters:
        appName - Indicates the name of the application from which the list of AIDs is to be removed.
        type - Indicates the AID type. The value can be CATEGORY_PAYMENT or CATEGORY_OTHER.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the list of AIDs is removed successfully; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • getAids

        public List<String> getAids​(ElementName appName,
                            String type)
        Obtains a list of AIDs of the specified type in a given application.

        This method only obtains AIDs that are dynamically registered using registerAids(ohos.bundle.ElementName,java.lang.String,java.util.List), and cannot obtain statically registered AIDs.

        Parameters:
        appName - Indicates the name of the application from which the list of AIDs is to be obtained.
        type - Indicates the AID type. The value can be CATEGORY_PAYMENT or CATEGORY_OTHER.
        Returns:
        Returns the list of AIDs of the specified type in the specified application.
        Since:
        3

      • isDefaultForType

        public boolean isDefaultForType​(ElementName appName,
                                String type)
        Checks whether the specified application is currently the default handler for the specified type.
        Parameters:
        appName - Indicates the name of the application to check.
        type - Indicates the specified type in a string, including 'payment' and 'other'.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the specified application is the default handler for the specified type; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4
